page.title: 18FADS AND FUN IN LAUGHARNE
page.content: Fashion in clothes and hair styles is very modified even with the younger generation. Eating out is a little more popular these days as is social drinking. Weekly bingo, in aid of the Memorial Hall, is popular. Sessions also attended in Tenby, by special bus. There are 'fruit machines' in pubs and clubs and football pools but the betting shop is now closed. A few take holidays abroad, more stay with relatives or friends in Britain. Visiting Garden Centres and Sunday markets are other increasing pastimes. There is a small recorder-playing group of WI members and a large amateur dramatic group "Laugharne Players", who produce a musical and variety show or pantomime annually. Professional wrestlers, Choirs and Theatre Groups also visit us. Cinema, theatre or disco 30-100 miles away.
